intro: Mentha × palatina var. scribae, commonly known as the Siberian mint, is a hybrid plant that exhibits characteristics of both Mentha × palatina and Mentha sibirica. It is a perennial herb with a creeping growth habit, often forming dense mats along the ground. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stems. Its leaves are oval to lance-shaped, with a serrated margin and a strong, aromatic scent. This variety is well adapted to cold climates and is often found in moist, temperate regions of the northern hemisphere.
